00072 typedef unsigned long spl_t;
00073 
00074 #define splhigh(x)  rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00075 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00076 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore((x) & 1)
00077 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00078 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00079 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00080 #define splnone()   rthal_sti()
00081 #define spltest()   rthal_local_irq_test()
00082 #define splget(x)   rthal_local_irq_flags(x)
00083 #define splsync(x)  rthal_local_irq_sync(x)
00084 
00085 typedef struct {
00086 
00087     volatile unsigned long lock;
00088 #if CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00089     const char *file;
00090     const char *function;
00091     unsigned line;
00092     int cpu;
00093 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00094 } xnlock_t;
00095 
00096 #ifndef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00097 #define XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED (xnlock_t) { 0 }
00098 #else
00099 #define XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED (xnlock_t) {       \
00100         0,                                      \
00101         NULL,                                   \
00102         0,                                      \
00103         -1                                      \
00104         }
00105 #endif /* !CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00106 
00107 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00108 
00109 #ifndef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00110 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)  ((x) = __xnlock_get_irqsave(lock))
00111 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00112 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x) \
00113     ((x) = __xnlock_get_irqsave(lock, __FILE__, __LINE__,__FUNCTION__))
00114 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00115 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)   xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,1)
00116 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)    xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,0)
00117 
00118 static inline void xnlock_init (xnlock_t *lock) {
00119 
00120     *lock = XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED;
00121 }
00122 
00123 #if CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00124 #define XNARCH_DEBUG_SPIN_LIMIT 3000000
00125 
00126 static inline spl_t
00127 __xnlock_get_irqsave (xnlock_t *lock, const char *file, unsigned line, const char *function)
00128 {
00129     unsigned spin_count = 0;
00130 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00131 static inline spl_t __xnlock_get_irqsave (xnlock_t *lock)
00132 {
00133 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00134     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00135     unsigned long flags;
00136 
00137     rthal_local_irq_save(flags);
00138 
00139     adeos_load_cpuid();
00140 
00141     if (!test_and_set_bit(cpuid,&lock->lock))
00142         {
00143         while (test_and_set_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,&lock->lock))
00144             {
00145             rthal_cpu_relax(cpuid);
00146 
00147 #if CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00148             if (++spin_count == XNARCH_DEBUG_SPIN_LIMIT)
00149                 {
00150                 adeos_set_printk_sync(adp_current);
00151                 printk(KERN_ERR
00152                        "RTAI: stuck on nucleus lock %p\n"
00153                        "      waiter = %s:%u (%s(), CPU #%d)\n"
00154                        "      owner  = %s:%u (%s(), CPU #%d)\n",
00155                        lock,file,line,function,cpuid,
00156                        lock->file,lock->line,lock->function,lock->cpu);
00157                 show_stack(NULL,NULL);
00158                 for (;;)
00159                     safe_halt();
00160                 }
00161 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00162             }
00163 
00164 #if CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG
00165         lock->file = file;
00166         lock->function = function;
00167         lock->line = line;
00168         lock->cpu = cpuid;
00169 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_DEBUG */
00170         }
00171     else
00172         flags |= 2;
00173 
00174     return flags;
00175 }
00176 
00177 static inline void xnlock_put_irqrestore (xnlock_t *lock, spl_t flags)
00178 
00179 {
00180     if (!(flags & 2))
00181         {
00182         adeos_declare_cpuid;
00183 
00184         rthal_cli();
00185 
00186         adeos_load_cpuid();
00187 
00188         if (test_and_clear_bit(cpuid,&lock->lock))
00189             clear_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,&lock->lock);
00190         }
00191 
00192     rthal_local_irq_restore(flags & 1);
00193 }
00194 
00195 #define XNARCH_PASSTHROUGH_IRQS \
00196 case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR: \
00197 case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR: \
00198 case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00199 
00200 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00201 
00202 #define xnlock_init(lock)              do { } while(0)
00203 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)     rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00204 #define xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00205 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)      rthal_cli()
00206 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)       rthal_sti()
00207 
00208 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00209 
00210 #define XNARCH_NR_CPUS               RTHAL_NR_CPUS
00211 
00212 #define XNARCH_DEFAULT_TICK          1000000 /* ns, i.e. 1ms */
00213 #define XNARCH_IRQ_MAX               IPIPE_NR_XIRQS /* Do _not_ use NR_IRQS here. */
00214 #ifdef CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC
00215 /* When the local APIC is enabled, we do not need to relay the host
00216    tick since 8254 interrupts are already flowing normally to Linux
00217    (i.e. the nucleus does not intercept it, but rather an APIC-based
00218    timer interrupt instead. */
00219 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK             0
00220 #else /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
00221 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK             (1000000000UL/HZ)
00222 #endif /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
00223 /* Using 3/4 of the average jitter is some constant obtained from
00224    experimentation that proved to fit on tested x86 platforms with
00225    respect to auto-calibration. In any case, a more accurate
00226    scheduling latency can still be fixed by setting
00227    CONFIG_RTAI_HW_SCHED_LATENCY properly. */
00228 #define xnarch_adjust_calibration(x) ((x) * 3 / 4)
00229

00231 #define XNARCH_ROOT_STACKSZ   0 /* Only a placeholder -- no stack */

00270 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00271 
00272     /* Kernel mode side */
00273     union i387_union fpuenv __attribute__ ((aligned (16))); /* FPU backup area */
00274     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00275     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00276     unsigned long esp;          /* Saved ESP for kernel-based threads */
00277     unsigned long eip;          /* Saved EIP for kernel-based threads */
00278 
00279     /* User mode side */
00280     struct task_struct *user_task;      /* Shadowed user-space task */
00281     struct task_struct *active_task;    /* Active user-space task */
00282 
00283     unsigned long *espp;        /* Pointer to ESP backup area (&esp or &user->thread.esp) */
00284     unsigned long *eipp;        /* Pointer to EIP backup area (&eip or &user->thread.eip) */
00285     union i387_union *fpup;     /* Pointer to the FPU backup area (&fpuenv or &user->thread.i387.f[x]save */
00286 
00287 } xnarchtcb_t;
00288

00294 
00295 } xnarch_fltinfo_t;

00297 #define xnarch_fault_trap(fi)  ((fi)->vector)
00298 #define xnarch_fault_code(fi)  ((fi)->errcode)
00299 #define xnarch_fault_pc(fi)    ((fi)->regs->eip)

00301 typedef struct xnarch_heapcb {
00302 
00303     atomic_t numaps;    /* # of active user-space mappings. */
00304 
00305     int kmflags;        /* Kernel memory flags (0 if vmalloc()). */
00306 
00307     void *heapbase;     /* Shared heap memory base (possibly unaligned). */
00308 
00309     void *shmbase;      /* Shared memory base (page-aligned). */
00310 
00311 } xnarch_heapcb_t;
00312 
00313 static inline void xnarch_init_heapcb (xnarch_heapcb_t *hcb)
00314 
00315 {
00316     atomic_set(&hcb->numaps,0);
00317     hcb->kmflags = 0;
00318     hcb->heapbase = NULL;
00319     hcb->shmbase = NULL;
00320 }

00326 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_tsc_to_ns (unsigned long long ts) {
00327     return xnarch_llimd(ts,1000000000,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ);
00328 }
00329 
00330 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_ns_to_tsc (unsigned long long ns) {
00331     return xnarch_llimd(ns,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ,1000000000);
00332 }
00333 
00334 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_time (void) {
00335     return xnarch_tsc_to_ns(xnarch_get_cpu_tsc());
00336 }
00337 
00338 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_freq (void) {
00339     return RTHAL_CPU_FREQ;
00340 }
00341 
00342 static inline unsigned xnarch_current_cpu (void) {
00343     return adeos_processor_id();
00344 }

00347 
00348     return kmalloc(bytes,GFP_ATOMIC);

00353     kfree(chunk);

00360 #define xnarch_halt(emsg) \
00361 do { \
00362     adeos_set_printk_sync(adp_current); \
00363     xnarch_logerr("fatal: %s\n",emsg); \
00364     show_stack(NULL,NULL);                      \
00365     for (;;) safe_halt();                       \
00366 } while(0)

00371 static inline int xnarch_setimask (int imask)
00372 
00373 {
00374     spl_t s;
00375     splhigh(s);
00376     splexit(!!imask);
00377     return !!s;
00378 }

00380 #ifdef XENO_INTR_MODULE
00381 
00382 static inline int xnarch_hook_irq (unsigned irq,
00383                                    void (*handler)(unsigned irq,
00384                                                    void *cookie),
00385                                    void *cookie)
00386 {
00387     int err = rthal_request_irq(irq,handler,cookie);
00388 
00389     if (!err)
00390         rthal_enable_irq(irq);
00391 
00392     return err;
00393 }
00394 
00395 static inline int xnarch_release_irq (unsigned irq) {
00396 
00397     return rthal_release_irq(irq);
00398 }
00399 
00400 static inline int xnarch_enable_irq (unsigned irq)
00401 
00402 {
00403     if (irq >= XNARCH_IRQ_MAX)
00404         return -EINVAL;
00405 
00406     rthal_enable_irq(irq);
00407 
00408     return 0;
00409 }
00410 
00411 static inline int xnarch_disable_irq (unsigned irq)
00412 
00413 {
00414     if (irq >= XNARCH_IRQ_MAX)
00415         return -EINVAL;
00416 
00417     rthal_disable_irq(irq);
00418 
00419     return 0;
00420 }
00421 
00422 static inline void xnarch_isr_chain_irq (unsigned irq) {
00423     rthal_pend_linux_irq(irq);
00424 }
00425 
00426 static inline void xnarch_isr_enable_irq (unsigned irq) {
00427     rthal_enable_irq(irq);
00428 }
00429 
00430 static inline void xnarch_relay_tick (void) {
00431 
00432     rthal_pend_linux_irq(RTHAL_8254_IRQ);
00433 }

00436                                                  cpumask_t affinity) {
00437     return adeos_set_irq_affinity(irq,affinity);
00438 }

00440 #endif /* XENO_INTR_MODULE */

00443 
00444 void xnpod_welcome_thread(struct xnthread *);

00447 
00448 unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
00449 
00450 {
00451 #if  CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
00452     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY);
00453 #else /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
00454     /* Compute the time needed to program the PIT in aperiodic
00455        mode. The return value is expressed in CPU ticks. Depending on
00456        whether CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC is enabled or not in the kernel
00457        configuration RTAI is compiled against,
00458        CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY will either refer to the local
00459        APIC or 8254 timer latency value. */
00460     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_calibrate_timer());
00461 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
00462 }
00463 
00464 static inline int xnarch_start_timer (unsigned long ns,
00465                                       void (*tickhandler)(void)) {
00466     return rthal_request_timer(tickhandler,ns);
00467 }
00468 
00469 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00470 
00471 {
00472     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00473 
00474     adeos_load_cpuid();
00475 
00476     /* rthal_cpu_realtime is only tested for the current processor,
00477        and always inside a critical section. */
00478     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00479     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00480     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_get_current(cpuid);
00481     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00482     rootcb->fpup = &rootcb->user_task->thread.i387;
00483 }
00484 
00485 static inline void xnarch_enter_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00486     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00487 }
00488 
00489 static inline void __switch_threads(xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00490                                     xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb,
00491                                     struct task_struct *outproc,
00492                                     struct task_struct *inproc
00493                                     )
00494 {
00495 #if __GNUC__ < 3 || __GNUC__ == 3 && __GNUC_MINOR__ < 2
00496 
00497     __asm__ __volatile__( \
00498         "pushl %%ecx\n\t" \
00499         "pushl %%edi\n\t" \
00500         "pushl %%ebp\n\t" \
00501         "movl %0,%%ecx\n\t" \
00502         "movl %%esp,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00503         "movl %1,%%ecx\n\t" \
00504         "movl $1f,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00505         "movl %2,%%ecx\n\t" \
00506         "movl %3,%%edi\n\t" \
00507         "movl (%%ecx),%%esp\n\t" \
00508         "pushl (%%edi)\n\t" \
00509         "testl %%edx,%%edx\n\t" \
00510         "jne  __switch_to\n\t" \
00511         "ret\n\t" \
00512 "1:      popl %%ebp\n\t" \
00513         "popl %%edi\n\t" \
00514         "popl %%ecx\n\t" \
00515       : /* no output */ \
00516       : "m" (out_tcb->espp), \
00517         "m" (out_tcb->eipp), \
00518         "m" (in_tcb->espp), \
00519         "m" (in_tcb->eipp), \
00520         "b" (out_tcb), \
00521         "S" (in_tcb), \
00522         "a" (outproc), \
00523         "d" (inproc));
00524 
00525 #else /* GCC version >= 3.2 */
00526 
00527     long ebx_out, ecx_out, edi_out, esi_out;
00528     
00529     __asm__ __volatile__( \
00530         "pushl %%ebp\n\t" \
00531         "movl %6,%%ecx\n\t" \
00532         "movl %%esp,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00533         "movl %7,%%ecx\n\t" \
00534         "movl $1f,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00535         "movl %8,%%ecx\n\t" \
00536         "movl %9,%%edi\n\t" \
00537         "movl (%%ecx),%%esp\n\t" \
00538         "pushl (%%edi)\n\t" \
00539         "testl %%edx,%%edx\n\t" \
00540         "jne  __switch_to\n\t" \
00541         "ret\n\t" \
00542 "1:      popl %%ebp\n\t" \
00543       : "=b" (ebx_out), \
00544         "=&c" (ecx_out), \
00545         "=S" (esi_out), \
00546         "=D" (edi_out), \
00547         "+a" (outproc), \
00548         "+d" (inproc) \
00549       : "m" (out_tcb->espp), \
00550         "m" (out_tcb->eipp), \
00551         "m" (in_tcb->espp), \
00552         "m" (in_tcb->eipp));
00553 
00554 #endif /* GCC version < 3.2 */
00555 }
00556 
00557 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00558                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00559 {
00560     struct task_struct *outproc = out_tcb->active_task;
00561     struct task_struct *inproc = in_tcb->user_task;
00562 
00563     if (inproc && outproc->thread_info->status & TS_USEDFPU)        
00564         /* __switch_to will try and use __unlazy_fpu, so that the ts
00565            bit need to be cleared. */
00566         clts();
00567     
00568     in_tcb->active_task = inproc ?: outproc;
00569 
00570     if (inproc && inproc != outproc)
00571         {
00572         struct mm_struct *oldmm = outproc->active_mm;
00573 
00574         switch_mm(oldmm,inproc->active_mm,inproc);
00575 
00576         if (!inproc->mm)
00577             enter_lazy_tlb(oldmm,inproc);
00578         }
00579 
00580     __switch_threads(out_tcb,in_tcb,outproc,inproc);
00581 
00582     stts();
00583 }
00584 
00585 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00586                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb) {
00587     xnarch_switch_to(dead_tcb,next_tcb);
00588 }
00589 
00590 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb) {
00591     /* Empty */
00592 }
00593 
00594 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00595 
00596 {
00597 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00598 
00599     if (!tcb->user_task) /* __switch_to() will take care otherwise. */
00600         {
00601         clts();
00602 
00603         if (cpu_has_fxsr)
00604             __asm__ __volatile__ ("fxsave %0; fnclex" : "=m" (*tcb->fpup));
00605         else
00606             __asm__ __volatile__ ("fnsave %0; fwait" : "=m" (*tcb->fpup));
00607         }
00608 
00609 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00610 }
00611 
00612 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00613 
00614 {
00615 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00616     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00617 
00618     if (task)
00619         {
00620         if (!task->used_math)
00621             {
00622             stts();
00623 
00624             return;     /* Uninit fpu area -- do not restore. */
00625             }
00626 
00627         /* Tell Linux that this task has altered the state of the FPU
00628            hardware. */
00629         task->thread_info->status |= TS_USEDFPU;
00630         }
00631 
00632     /* Restore the FPU hardware with valid fp registers from a
00633        user-space or kernel thread. */
00634 
00635     clts();
00636 
00637     if (cpu_has_fxsr)
00638         __asm__ __volatile__ ("fxrstor %0": /* no output */ : "m" (*tcb->fpup));
00639     else
00640         __asm__ __volatile__ ("frstor %0": /* no output */ : "m" (*tcb->fpup));
00641 
00642 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00643 }
00644 
00645 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00646                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00647                                          const char *name)
00648 {
00649     tcb->user_task = current;
00650     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00651     tcb->esp = 0;
00652     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00653     tcb->eipp = &tcb->eip;
00654     tcb->fpup = NULL;
00655 }
00656 
00657 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb) {
00658 
00659     tcb->user_task = NULL;
00660     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00661     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00662     tcb->eipp = &tcb->eip;
00663     tcb->fpup = &tcb->fpuenv;
00664     /* Must be followed by xnarch_init_thread(). */
00665 }
00666 
00667 asmlinkage static void xnarch_thread_redirect (struct xnthread *self,
00668                                                int imask,
00669                                                void(*entry)(void *),
00670                                                void *cookie)
00671 {
00672     /* xnpod_welcome_thread() will do clts() if needed. */
00673     stts();
00674     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!imask);
00675     xnpod_welcome_thread(self);
00676     entry(cookie);
00677     xnpod_delete_thread(self);
00678 }
00679 
00680 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00681                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00682                                        void *cookie,
00683                                        int imask,
00684                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00685                                        char *name)
00686 {
00687     unsigned long **psp = (unsigned long **)&tcb->esp;
00688 
00689     tcb->eip = (unsigned long)&xnarch_thread_redirect;
00690     tcb->esp = (unsigned long)tcb->stackbase;
00691     **psp = 0;  /* Commit bottom stack memory */
00692     *psp = (unsigned long *)(((unsigned long)*psp + tcb->stacksize - 0x10) & ~0xf);
00693     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)cookie;
00694     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)entry;
00695     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)imask;
00696     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)thread;
00697     *--(*psp) = 0;
00698 }
00699 
00700 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00701 
00702 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00703 
00704 {
00705     /* Initialize the FPU for an emerging kernel-based RT thread. This
00706        must be run on behalf of the emerging thread. */
00707 
00708     __asm__ __volatile__ ("clts; fninit");
00709 
00710     if (cpu_has_xmm)
00711         {
00712         unsigned long __mxcsr = 0x1f80UL & 0xffbfUL;
00713         __asm__ __volatile__ ("ldmxcsr %0": : "m" (__mxcsr));
00714         }
00715 }
00716 
00717 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00718 
00719 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb) {
00720 }
00721 
00722 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00723 
00724 void xnarch_sleep_on (int *flagp) {
00725 
00726     while (!*flagp)
00727         {
00728         set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00729         schedule_timeout(1);
00730         }
00731 }

00736 
00737     return adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0, cpumask);
00738 }

00740 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void))
00741 
00742 {
00743     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00744                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00745                                      (void (*)(unsigned)) handler,
00746                                      NULL,
00747                                      IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00748 }
00749 
00750 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void)
00751 
00752 {
00753     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00754                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00755                                      NULL,
00756                                      NULL,
00757                                      IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00758 }
00759 
00760 static struct semaphore xnarch_finalize_sync;
00761 
00762 static void xnarch_finalize_cpu(unsigned irq)
00763 {
00764     up(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00765 }
00766 
00767 static inline void xnarch_notify_halt(void)
00768     
00769 {
00770     unsigned cpu, nr_cpus = num_online_cpus();
00771     cpumask_t other_cpus = cpu_online_map;
00772     unsigned long flags;
00773     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00774 
00775     init_MUTEX_LOCKED(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00776 
00777     /* Here adp_current is in fact root, since xnarch_notify_halt is
00778        called from xnpod_shutdown, itself called from Linux
00779        context. */
00780     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(adp_current, ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2,
00781                               xnarch_finalize_cpu, NULL, IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00782 
00783     adeos_lock_cpu(flags);
00784     cpu_clear(cpuid, other_cpus);
00785     adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2, other_cpus);
00786     adeos_unlock_cpu(flags);
00787 
00788     for(cpu=0; cpu < nr_cpus-1; ++cpu)
00789         down(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00790     
00791     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(adp_current, ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2, NULL, NULL,
00792                               IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00793 }
00794 
00795 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00796 
00797 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (cpumask_t cpumask) {
00798 
00799     return 0;
00800 }
00801 
00802 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void)) {
00803 
00804     return 0;
00805 }
00806 
00807 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void) {
00808 
00809     return 0;
00810 }
00811 
00812 #define xnarch_notify_halt() /* Nullified */
00813 
00814 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00815 
00816 static inline void xnarch_notify_shutdown(void)
00817 
00818 {
00819 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00820     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00821        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00822     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00823 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00824     xnshadow_release_events();
00825     /* Wait for the currently processed events to drain. */
00826     set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00827     schedule_timeout(50);
00828     xnarch_release_ipi();
00829 }
00830 
00831 static inline int xnarch_escalate (void)
00832 
00833 {
00834     extern int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00835 
00836     if (adp_current == adp_root)
00837         {
00838         spl_t s;
00839         splsync(s);
00840         adeos_trigger_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00841         splexit(s);
00842         return 1;
00843         }
00844 
00845     return 0;
00846 }
00847 
00848 static void xnarch_notify_ready (void) {
00849     
00850     xnshadow_grab_events();
00851 }
00852 
00853 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */

00855 #ifdef XENO_SHADOW_MODULE
00856 
00857 static inline void xnarch_init_shadow_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00858                                            struct xnthread *thread,
00859                                            const char *name)
00860 {
00861     struct task_struct *task = current;
00862 
00863     tcb->user_task = task;
00864     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00865     tcb->esp = 0;
00866     tcb->espp = &task->thread.esp;
00867     tcb->eipp = &task->thread.eip;
00868     tcb->fpup = &task->thread.i387;
00869 }
00870 
00871 static inline void xnarch_grab_xirqs (void (*handler)(unsigned irq))
00872 
00873 {
00874     unsigned irq;
00875 
00876     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00877         adeos_virtualize_irq(irq,
00878                              handler,
00879                              NULL,
00880                              IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00881 }
00882 
00883 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00884 
00885 {
00886     unsigned irq;
00887 
00888     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00889         {
00890         switch (irq)
00891             {
00892 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00893             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00894             case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00895             case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00896             case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00897 
00898                 /* Never lock out these ones. */
00899                 continue;
00900 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00901 
00902             default:
00903 
00904                 __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,irq);
00905             }
00906         }
00907 }
00908 
00909 static inline void xnarch_unlock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00910 
00911 {
00912     unsigned irq;
00913 
00914     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00915         {
00916         switch (irq)
00917             {
00918 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00919             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00920             case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00921             case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00922             case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00923 
00924                 continue;
00925 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00926 
00927             default:
00928 
00929                 __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,irq);
00930             }
00931         }
00932 }

00934 #endif /* XENO_SHADOW_MODULE */

00936 #ifdef XENO_TIMER_MODULE
00937 
00938 static inline void xnarch_program_timer_shot (unsigned long long delay) {
00939     /* Delays are expressed in CPU ticks, so we need to keep a 64bit
00940        value here, especially for 64bit arch ports using an interval
00941        timer based on the internal cycle counter of the CPU. */ 
00942     rthal_set_timer_shot(rthal_imuldiv(delay,RTHAL_TIMER_FREQ,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ));
00943 }
00944 
00945 static inline void xnarch_stop_timer (void) {
00946     rthal_release_timer();
00947 }
00948 
00949 #endif /* XENO_TIMER_MODULE */
00950 
00951 #ifdef XENO_MAIN_MODULE
00952 
00953 int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00954 
00955 int xnpod_trap_fault(xnarch_fltinfo_t *fltinfo);
00956 
00957 void xnpod_schedule_handler(void);
00958 
00959 static rthal_trap_handler_t xnarch_old_trap_handler;
00960 
00961 static int xnarch_trap_fault (adevinfo_t *evinfo)
00962 {
00963     xnarch_fltinfo_t fltinfo;
00964 
00965     fltinfo.vector = evinfo->event;
00966     fltinfo.errcode = ((struct pt_regs *)evinfo->evdata)->orig_eax;
00967     fltinfo.regs = (struct pt_regs *)evinfo->evdata;
00968 
00969     return xnpod_trap_fault(&fltinfo);
00970 }
00971 
00972 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
00973 
00974 {
00975     int err;
00976 
00977 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00978     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00979        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00980     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00981 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00982 
00983     xnarch_escalation_virq = adeos_alloc_irq();
00984 
00985     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
00986         return -ENOSYS;
00987 
00988     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00989                               xnarch_escalation_virq,
00990                               (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
00991                               NULL,
00992                               IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00993 
00994     xnarch_old_trap_handler = rthal_set_trap_handler(&xnarch_trap_fault);
00995 
00996     err = xnshadow_mount();
00997 
00998     if (err)
00999         adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
01000 
01001     return err;
01002 }
01003 
01004 static inline void xnarch_exit (void) {
01005 
01006     xnshadow_cleanup();
01007     rthal_set_trap_handler(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
01008     adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
01009 }
01010 
01011 #endif /* XENO_MAIN_MODULE */

01018 #if CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC

01020 #define RTAI_TRACE_TIMER_IRQ       RTHAL_APIC_TIMER_IPI

01023 #else /* !CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
01024

01026 #define linux_timer_irq_count(cpu) (kstat_cpu(cpu).irqs[RTHAL_8254_IRQ])
01027 
01028 #endif /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */

01030 #define tsc2ms(timestamp)          rthal_ulldiv((timestamp), cpu_khz, NULL)
